author: Anna Jones
name: Chilli Vinegar Noodles with Sesame Tofu
ingredients:
- A small piece (10g) of ginger, grated
- 4 tbsp sriracha or chilli sauce
- 3 tbsp maple syrup
- 4 tbsp rice wine vinegar
- 3 tbsp soy sauce or tamari
- 1/2 a white or sweetheart cabbage, very finely sliced
- 250g firm tofu, cut into 1x3cm pieces
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- 2 tbsp sesame seeds
- 200g egg or udon noodles
- 1/2 bunch of coriander (15g)
instructions:
**Make the dressing
- Grate the ginger into a small bool and add 4 tbsp sriracha, 2 tbsp maple syrup, 4 tbsp rice wine vinegar and 2 tbsp soy sauce. Taste and add more soy if you like it salty.

** Dress the cabbage
- Scoop the sliced cabbage into a mizing bowl, add 2 tbsp of the dressing and scrench everything together with your hands so it's all evenly coated. Set aside.

** Slice and cook the tofu
- Heat a large frying pan over medium heat, add 2 tbsp vegetable oil and fry the sliced tofy until golden on all sides. Add 2 tbsp sesame seeds to toast for 30 seconds, then take the pan off the heat. Add 1 tbsp of soy and stir for a minute before adding 1 tbsp of maple syrup.

**Cook and dress the noodles
- Cook 200g noodles for a minute less than the packet instructions. Drain, keeping a little of the water. Tip them into the tofu pan, add the remaining dressing and a splash of the noodle water put back over a medium heat for a minute or two until everything is coated in the vinegary sauce.

** Serve
- Divide the noodles and tofu between two bowls and top with the cabbage salad and the leaves from 1/2 a bunch of coriander.
